isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 1.6: SENSOR OPERATION - TYPES OF SENSORS - SWITCH SENSORS

svcproc.title: SWITCH SENSORS
svcproc.para: Switch sensors are used to indicate positions. They operate either open or closed allowing or preventing the flow of current in each case. A switch sensor can be either a voltage input type switch or a grounding type switch. A voltage input type switch will supply the ECM with a voltage when it is closed, while a grounding type switch will ground the circuit closed, causing a zero voltage signal. Grounding type switches are usually installed in series with a current limiting resistor. Refer to Figure 1.28.
This sensor is connected to the ECM by two wires: a 12 volt signal and a signal ground. These sensors are considered to be a low speed digital input.
